title: iShares Core Dividend Growth ETF Experiences Big Inflow - Nasdaq.com
text: Looking today at week-over-week shares outstanding changes among the universe of ETFs covered at ETF Channel , one standout is the iShares Core Dividend Growth ETF (Symbol: DGRO) where we have detected an approximate $78.6 million dollar inflow -- that's a 1.0% increase week over week in outstanding units (from 210,450,000 to 212,500,000). Among the largest underlying components of DGRO, in trading today Verizon Communications Inc (Symbol: VZ) is up about 0.1%, Procter & Gamble Company (Symbol: PG) is off about 0.8%, and Home Depot Inc (Symbol: HD) is up by about 1.5%. For a complete list of holdings, visit the DGRO Holdings page » The chart below shows the one year price performance of DGRO, versus its 200 day moving average:
